intro: Voacanga angolensis, commonly known as the African locust bean tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, elongated fruits that contain hard, woody seeds. It is often found in dry savannas and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties. The tree is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
